column2: # In a # Dynamic section, create your ggplots styled in a way befitting of a more "fun" and "dynamic" outlet, such as a blog, tweet, etc., (this is where you should strut your stuff/push your boundaries). Again provide a brief ## Summary of what you think each plot tells us, and a ## Justification of the styling/formatting decisions that you made
labs(x = "Month of report (January to December)", y = "Day of the week\n(Monday to Friday)", title = "Figure 3.",
caption = paste("Rates reported from ", covid.daily.long$report_date[[1]], " to ", tail(covid.daily.long$report_date, n=1), ".\n",
